content: **relaxing hat** is an easy knit that is worked in the round from the bottom to the top pattern is quite versatile you may opt for a folded brim or simply adjust the length of the brim based on your preferred looks and fit if you decide to use twisted purl stitches it looks great from the wrong side as well both written instructions and charts are provided including a link to the video for a stretchy cast-on **size ** to fit 53-58 cm head circumference to fit most adult heads **yarn suggestions ** malabrigo yarn sock light fingering 1 skein = appx 100 grams / 3 53 ounces 402 meters / 440 yards two strands of light-fingering yarn held together 95 grams 382 meters / 418 yards used for the sample shown in variegated color or malabrigo yarn rios light worsted 1 skein = appx 100 grams / 3 53 ounces 192 meters / 210 yards 95 grams 182 meters / 200 yards used for the sample shown in green color **needles & notions ** circular needle size 3 25 mm / us3 40 cm / 16 for the brim circular needle size 3 5 mm / us4 40 cm / 16 for the hat body for the crown shaping use dpns two circulars or a magic loop technique dpns optional stitch marker tapestry needle **gauge** 10 cm / 4 28 stitches worked in the pattern used for the brim with 3 25 mm / us3 needle 10 cm / 4 24 stitches worked in the pattern used for the body of the hat with 3 5 mm / us4 needle 10 x 10 cm / 4x4 24 stitches 17 row in stockinette stitch 3 25 mm / us3 needle **difficulty ** beginner **required skills ** cast on knitting in the round knit and purl stitches ktbl twisted purl stitches - optional part of combination knitting decreases k2tog skp p2tog
